result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Marlos Alicea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
To be supervision by the Mental Health unit of Dept. of Corrections. Credit for 2 days per this case.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (and terms of Extended Supervision):
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.  Anger Management evaluation and any recommended treatment. Parenting counseling.
Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication). AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Random screens.
No drugs without a valid prescription. No Contact Order with Duane M.
Mental Health evaluation and any recommended treatment. Take all prescribed medication.

No fine. Court orders defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done.  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.  Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay during the term of probation a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Court sets Restitution in the amount of $0 (Zero).
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armo and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed and Filed: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment/Denied. Mailed to Defendant and State.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. jbs
Original GUILTY PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (46 pages) commencing JULY 24, 2014 received and filed.  jm

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by Duane M., the State, Evelyn A., defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  4 years with 2 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2  years.   
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

As to Count 3:
Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.  Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit of Dept. of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (and terms of extended supervision):  
- Absolute Sobriety (except for prescribed medication)
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
- Random screens
- Mental Health evaluation and any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- No Contact Order with Duane M.
- Court sets Restitution in the amount of $0 (Zero)
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy
- Anger Management evaluation and any recommended treatment
- Seek/Maintain employment
- Job/Vocational training
- Parenting counseling 
- No fine
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay during the term of probation a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed. Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
from Renew Counseling Services and defendant - received and filed.

Defendant Jesus Marlos Alicea in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Deann L. Heard, appearing for Jay Pucek, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant sworn as to his statements.

As to Count 1 and Count 3:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
